CSSNumericValue.summary: The CSSNumericValue interface of the CSS Typed Object Model API represents operations that all numeric values can perform.

CSSNumericValueAdd.summary:
The add() method of the
interface adds a supplied number to the
CSSNumericValue.

CSSNumericValueDiv.summary:
The div() method of the
interface divides the CSSNumericValue by the
supplied value.

CSSNumericValueEquals.summary:
The equals() method of the
interface returns a boolean indicating whether the passed
value are strictly equal. To return a value of true, all passed values must
be of the same type and value and must be in the same order. This allows structural
equality to be tested quickly.

CSSNumericValueMax.summary:
The max() method of the
interface returns the highest value from among the values
passed. The passed values must be of the same type.

CSSNumericValueMin.summary:
The min() method of the
interface returns the lowest value from among those
values passed. The passed values must be of the same type.

CSSNumericValueMul.summary:
The mul() method of the
interface multiplies the CSSNumericValue by
the supplied value.

CSSNumericValueParse.summary:
The parse() static method of the
interface converts a value string into an object whose
members are value and the units.

CSSNumericValueSub.summary:
The sub() method of the
interface subtracts a supplied number from the
CSSNumericValue.

CSSNumericValueTo.summary:
The to() method of the
interface converts a numeric value from one unit to
another.

CSSNumericValueToSum.summary:
The toSum() method of the
interface converts the object's value to a
object to values of the specified unit.

CSSNumericValueType.summary:
The type() method of the
interface returns the type of
CSSNumericValue, one of angle, flex,
frequency, length, resolution,
percent, percentHint, or time.
CSSNumericValueType.returns: A CSSNumericType dictionary, which contains the following properties:For each property except percentHint, the value is an integer representing the power of that unit. For example, a numeric value of calc(1px * 1em) will return { length: 2 }.The percentHint property is a string that indicates the type of value that the percent is applied to. The string value is the same as the type properties: "length", "angle", "time", "frequency", "resolution", "flex", or "percent". It indicates that the type actually holds a percentage, but that percentage will eventually resolve to the hinted base type, and so has been replaced with it in the type.
